file_content.text: Veshikk Urk is dead, my master.
Did you really think he stood a chance against me?
Of course he is.
Memory has played me for a fool--Veshikk, Tulak Hord, none of them were as I remembered.
I thank you for your help, my master, but it was neither needed nor desired.
But you--you have earned my respect, if not my loyalty.
You have my sympathy.
Isn't it enough to learn of my master's betrayal by my only friend? Must I also endure your pity?
Just try not to get your tears all over everything.
You're a sentimental fool.
Your insults mean nothing to me, little Sith. But someday, I will kill you and be free.
Now, my master, if it pleases you, let us leave this dismal place and never speak of these ghosts again.
I never doubted you for a moment.
You did well, slave.
Ah, Khem, my proud friend. How long I have waited!
I see you have found yourself a pet. It smells weak, but I suppose there is some potential there.
I am Khem Val's master, not his pet.
Pet! Not likely.
Ah, my friend, I am sorry. It must have been a long fall from glory.
I am not weak.
Ha! Another defiant Sith with delusions of grandeur.
Watch what you say, beast, or I'll bind you as well.
Don't push me.
Bind me? A slave once more, Khem? It must have been a long fall from glory.
But you always were soft, weren't you? Always favored, always the best. If I didn't know better, I'd say you even loved that Sith animal you called a master.
Enough! I was not weak, you were weak. A slave to that monster, Ortan Cela.
I don't like people insulting Khem.
Be careful, Veshikk.
What do you intend to do about it, little Sith? I am no slave, not like Khem. These Sith serve me.
Calm down. We're all friends here.
Easy, you two.
Friends? Khem Val was no friend of mine. He never let it be forgotten who was the stronger assassin. I despised him.
What new lies are these?
Tu-dok something-or-other, enslaver of Dashade, invader of Urkupp, devourer of dignity! He died with my master's lightsaber in his back. I devoured his Force energy myself.
Master, grant me leave to kill this monster!
I'm never one to shy away from a good killing.
My pleasure. [Attack Veshikk]
Certainly. [Attack Veshikk]
My pets will make quick work of you, I think.
I don't want bloodshed.
No.
Well, that's a nice thought, but I didn't lure Khem here because I was lonely.
Come, my old friend, it's time we settled once and for all which of us is stronger.
I'm ready, Veshikk.
I know a way to shut this guy up.
Let's kill him.
Foolish Khem and foolish little Sith.
Ortan Cela was cruel, it's true. Petty and insignificant by all accounts. That was the only reason your pitiful master trusted him, and that was his mistake.
